title: Provost-Marshal: a romance of the middle shires
author: Moncreiff, Frederick Charles
snippet: Perceiving, Avhen they approachedSaughtree Fell, that Cranstoun's courage was beginningto fail, he ventured to offer a suggestion.

title: Provost-Marshal: a romance of the middle shires
author: Moncreiff, Frederick Charles
snippet: Taking ten men with him, and leaving the Lieutenantwith the remainder of the force, he followed the trackall day; but the march was very severe, and whenhe reached Saughtree Fell the trail was lost, and theday was declining.

title: Provost-Marshal: a romance of the middle shires
author: Moncreiff, Frederick Charles
snippet: When the Guard reached Saughtree Fell the afternoon was far spent.

title: Provost-Marshal: a romance of the middle shires
author: Moncreiff, Frederick Charles
snippet: Passing over the spot now occupied byRiccarton Junction, he rode on to Saughtree Fell, amost wild and desolate country, being indeed a seaof hills to all appearance without inhabitants, orwoods, or cultivation.
